verses.kjv: In thee, O LORD, do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed: deliver me in thy righteousness.
verses.ct: LORD, I have placed my trust in you; don't ever let me be disgraced. Rescue me through your righteousness.

verses.kjv: Bow down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily: be thou my strong rock, for an house of defence to save me.
verses.ct: Listen closely to me; save me quickly. Be my solid rock, a fortress of protection to keep me safe.

verses.kjv: For thou art my rock and my fortress; therefore for thy name’s sake lead me, and guide me.
verses.ct: You truly are my rock and my fortress; so for the honor of your name, lead me and guide me.

verses.kjv: Pull me out of the net that they have laid privily for me: for thou art my strength.
verses.ct: Free me from the trap they have secretly set for me, because you are my strength.

verses.kjv: Into thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O LORD God of truth.
verses.ct: I place my spirit in your hands. You have rescued me, LORD, God of truth.

verses.kjv: I have hated them that regard lying vanities: but I trust in the LORD.
verses.ct: I despise those who cling to worthless idols, but I put my trust in the LORD.

verses.kjv: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;
verses.ct: I will celebrate and find joy in your mercy, because you have paid attention to my suffering; you have understood my soul during hard times.

verses.kjv: And hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large room.
verses.ct: You have not handed me over to my enemy; instead, you have given me room to stand freely.

verses.kjv: Have mercy upon me, O LORD, for I am in trouble: mine eye is consumed with grief, yea, my soul and my belly.
verses.ct: Show me mercy, LORD, because I am in distress. My eyes are worn out from grief — my soul and my body as well.

verses.kjv: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing: my strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are consumed.
verses.ct: My life is wasting away in sorrow, and my years pass in groaning. My strength is failing because of my sin, and my bones are deteriorating.

verses.kjv: I was a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that did see me without fled from me.
verses.ct: I have become an object of scorn to all my enemies, especially to my neighbors, and something dreaded by people who know me. Those who saw me on the street ran away from me.

verses.kjv: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.
verses.ct: I am forgotten like someone who has died and passed from memory. I am like a shattered piece of pottery.

verses.kjv: For I have heard the slander of many: fear was on every side: while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life.
verses.ct: I have heard the whispered accusations of many people. Terror surrounds me on every side. They conspired together against me, plotting to end my life.

verses.kjv: But I trusted in thee, O LORD: I said, Thou art my God.
verses.ct: But I put my trust in you, LORD. I declared, 'You are my God.'

verses.kjv: My times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.
verses.ct: My future is in your hands. Rescue me from my enemies and from those who are chasing me down.

verses.kjv: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: save me for thy mercies’ sake.
verses.ct: Look on your servant with favor. Save me because of your mercy.

verses.kjv: Let me not be ashamed, O LORD; for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.
verses.ct: LORD, don't let me be disgraced, because I have called out to you. Let the wicked be disgraced instead, and let them be silenced in the grave.

verses.kjv: Let the lying lips be put to silence; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.
verses.ct: Let lying mouths be shut — those that speak harsh and arrogant words with contempt against those who do right.

verses.kjv: Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men!
verses.ct: How incredible is your goodness that you have stored up for those who deeply revere you, that you have done for those who trust in you in full view of everyone!

verses.kjv: Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence from the pride of man: thou shalt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.
verses.ct: You shelter them in the safety of your presence from the schemes of arrogant people. You hide them in a protected place from the attacks of hostile tongues.

verses.kjv: Blessed be the LORD: for he hath shewed me his marvellous kindness in a strong city.
verses.ct: Praise the LORD, because he showed me his amazing kindness when I was in a city under siege.

verses.kjv: For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.
verses.ct: In my panic I said, 'I am completely cut off from your sight!' But even so, you heard my desperate pleas when I cried out to you.

verses.kjv: O love the LORD, all ye his saints: for the LORD preserveth the faithful, and plentifully rewardeth the proud doer.
verses.ct: Love the LORD, all of you who are devoted to him! The LORD protects the faithful, but he fully repays those who act with arrogance.

verses.kjv: Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the LORD.
verses.ct: Be strong and take courage, all of you who put your hope in the LORD, and he will strengthen your heart.
